At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
Tijdens de meeloopstage draai je mee als teamlid van het NL Public Policy Team. Je zult andere teamleden ondersteunen, maar ook zelfstandig zaken oppakken en eigen input wordt zeker gewaardeerd.
The opportunity
Het NL Public Policy Team focust zich op het maatschappelijk debat, de ontwikkelingen binnen het accountantsberoep en alles wat daarbij komt kijken. Denk bijvoorbeeld aan de lopende opdracht van de Kwartiermakers Toekomst Accountancysector, maar ook ontwikkelingen op het gebied van Digital en Duurzaamheid. Het team onderhoudt contact met allerlei externe stakeholders, verzorgt diverse publicaties en informeert EY-collega’s. Hiervoor wordt veelvuldig geschakeld met mensen binnen en buiten EY.
Je levert hiermee een belangrijke bijdrage voor het accountantsberoep als geheel en EY in het bijzonder, met echte maatschappelijke impact. Het is kortweg een kijkje in de keuken op geheel ander niveau en je krijgt de kans om binnen een frisse en constructieve omgeving, met directe begeleiding en korte lijntjes, nieuwe kennis op te doen en jezelf verder te ontwikkelen.
Your key responsibilities
Je ondersteunt het public policy team gedurende je stageperiode bij allerlei projecten.
Je krijgt verantwoordelijkheden op het gebied van onderzoek, schrijven van publicaties en stakeholdercontacten en communicatie via social media .
Je wordt aangemoedigd met het team mee te denken en originele ideeën te delen
Je krijgt tijdens jouw stage persoonlijke begeleiding van ervaren collega’s uit de praktijk.
Skills and attributes for success
Hoe word jij onderdeel van het NL Public Policy Team?
To qualify for the role you must have
Je bent bezig met je bachelor of master.
Je volgt een HBO of WO opleiding in de richting van Accountancy, Communicatiewetenschappen, Finance, media of bestuurskunde
Je kunt zowel in het Nederlands als Engels goed communiceren.
Ideally, you’ll also have
Je vindt het leuk om in een divers team te werken en nieuwe contacten te leggen.
Je bent ambitieus en vindt het afleveren van kwalitatief goed werk vanzelfsprekend.
Je vindt het leuk om te schrijven en eigen onderzoek te doen.
Je vindt het leuk om out-of-the-box te denken en bezig te zijn met social media.
Je hebt al enige affiniteit met de accountancy of bent bereid je erin te verdiepen.
What we look for
Iedereen is uniek. Bij EY hechten wij daarom veel waarde aan wie jij bent naast je werk. Bring yourself, build you future!
What we offer
Het team waarin je terecht komt, de collega’s om je heen en je werkzaamheden dragen bij aan je werkplezier. Maar werken doe je niet voor niets. Daarom bieden wij jou aantrekkelijke arbeidsvoorwaarden. Flexibel werken, dat vinden we bij EY heel gewoon. Ook bepaal je bij EY jouw eigen loopbaanontwikkeling: met energie, gedrevenheid, inlevingsvermogen en durf staat niets jouw carrière in de weg. Hoe meer je je ontwikkelt, hoe meer mogelijkheden je ontdekt om je carrière te sturen en deze net zo uniek te maken als je zelf bent. Wat je nog meer kan verwachten bij EY:
Werk aan interessante opdrachten met een sterk innovatief karakter bij een gevarieerde en uitdagende groep klanten
Een stagevergoeding van €900 bruto per maand op basis van 40 uur per week
Word onderdeel van een top werkgever!
Samenwerken doen we in diversiteit. We werken in een omgeving waarin 'gelijkheid in diversiteit' in ons beleid is verankerd, met als resultaat betere teamresultaten
Een stageperiode van minimaal 6 maanden, met start en einddatum in overleg

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
Our business is highly regulated and EY is a complex, matrixed organization. Managing risk is of paramount importance to our brand and reputation, and our Risk Management team works side-by-side with the business to do this. Our aim is to enable responsible growth and that means working with the business to identify, monitor and manage risk, and consult and advise. Through oversight of key risk issues and processes such as independence, conflicts, and legal and regulatory compliance, we help maximize public trust and enable EY to responsibly provide excellent client service.
The opportunity
This opportunity is an ideal role for an individual who wants to directly contribute to EY’s global organization. The role will be part of the Global Data Protection team that in collaboration with GCO manage the EY Data Protection program to ensure EY and client data is used and protected in line with internal policy and external regulation to minimize risk to the network.
This is an exciting time to join Risk Management. Enabling responsible growth and working together with the business to do this is at the heart of many of the Next Wave strategic priorities, in particular where this applies to the increased use of data and reliance on new technologies. We are looking for professionals, interested in Risk Management, to join the data protection team in global Risk Management. You will build your professional knowledge and credentials, learn how EY operates globally and work with some of the most senior partners.
Your key responsibilities
The Senior Associate within Risk Management would be expected to develop subject matter knowledge on various Risk Management functions and processes, including interpreting policies and processes, determining required actions and making recommendations based on EY guidance and acquired experience. The incumbent would be responsible for analyzing issues and producing high quality deliverables. The position would be expected to interact with Senior Executives within EY. You will be responsible for supporting all aspects of the Risk Management Data Protection team, with initial focus on the risk associated with external parties (suppliers), but also with a view to other programmatic areas such as Incident Management, Training and Awareness, ERM and policy/guidance to enable the business.
Skills and attributes for success
The candidate should be comfortable working in an unstructured & complex environment requiring out of box thinking, logical reasoning
The candidate should be able to continuously add value to assigned processes and develop solutions
Ability to learn and understand the EY’s Risk Management policies as well as familiarity with other Risk Management/Data Protection initiatives outside of area of expertise
Ability to manage tasks and activities in a timely manner
Ability to keep confidential sensitive information
Strong research and communications skills
Ability to successfully handle multiple tasks.
Interest in working with a culturally diverse team from around the globe to design, develop, and deploy programs and share knowledge
Team player and active listener with the ability to respond to and develop the ideas of others
Appreciation for data protection principles and application of controls to protection confidential and personal data.
To qualify for the role you must have
University graduate with 2-3 years of experience
Good academic background
Advanced MS office knowledge (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Candidates with exposure to client interaction would be preferred
Candidates with a recognised data protection/data privacy qualification (e.g. CIPP) would be preferred
Ideally, you’ll also have
Ability to operate and flex in an ambiguous and changing environment to respond to emerging priorities
Experience of working to deadlines and delivering high quality outputs
Ability and willingness to periodically work flexibly e.g., participating in calls outside of standard office hours (early morning/late night) to support our global organization
What we look for
We’re looking for an experienced, high energy individual who embraces change and innovation in order to ensure that we can continue to deliver world-class RM initiatives in an ever-changing environment.
What we offer
As part of this role, you'll work in a highly integrated, global team with the opportunity and tools to grow, develop and drive your career forward. Here, you can combine global opportunity with flexible working. The EY benefits package goes above and beyond too, focusing on your physical, emotional, financial and social well-being. Your recruiter can talk to you about the benefits available in your country. Here’s a snapshot of what we offer:
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
The opportunity
Globalization and technological developments rapidly change the world we live in. For many organizations, this results in complex challenges – in terms of risks as well as opportunities! The colleagues of the Supply Chain & Operations team of EY have a passion to support clients in embracing those challenges. We do this, for example, by transforming complex business processes, and structurally optimize the way our clients operate.
As part of the team, you will help our clients to bridge the gap between strategy and operational performance and with that, create long term value for the company and its customers. You will continuously be challenged on soft- as well as hard skills and will work closely with both the client and experienced EY colleagues. This way, your own development never stops!
Your responsibilities
As part of the Supply Chain & Operations team, you help organizations from various industries (FMCG, pharma, automotive, finance, public etc.) with their most complex challenges across different domains (Procurement, Logistics, Planning, Manufacturing, and Services). You will make an impact from day one. For example, by preparing and facilitating workshops for the client on key subjects like inventory management, warehouse optimization, sustainable supply chains, smart factories (Industry 4.0), or continuous process improvement (Lean/Six Sigma). In your daily work, you will also be exposed to the client frequently by conducting interviews or applying and supporting them to implement improved standard ways of working. And the next day, you are gathering and analyzing quantitative and qualitative data, and collaborate with your colleagues to present the outcome of your analysis to the client. This way, you will experience a steep learning curve. Before you know, you are the expert in the field, providing the client with training and coaching!
Success criteria
Are you enthusiastic about transforming, digitizing, and improving business processes and are you motivated to contribute to that as part of the Supply Chain & Operations team?
You have
A recently obtained Master's degree with above average grades in the field of Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Industrial Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Strategic Management, Innovation Management, or similar
A strong analytical mindset, excellent communication skills, and fluent Dutch and English language skills (both verbal as well as in writing)
A demonstrated drive to develop yourself continuously, for example, through a relevant internship or side-job, a board year, or other extra-curricular activities
The drive to continuously improve your own work and that of our clients
The willingness to travel abroad
Ideally, you also have
Practical experience (e.g. internship, side-job) in the field of procurement, logistics, planning, production, or service
Affinity with data analysis, technology and innovation
Affinity with Lean and Six Sigma
Dutch language skills
European language skills other than English or Dutch
What we are looking for
Are you one of a kind? Are you communicative, social, analytic, practical, pragmatic, and fun to work with? Are you eager to develop yourself as a consultant and within the Supply Chain & Operations domain specifically, and can you convince us that we could take you with us to the client as of tomorrow? Then we are pleased to welcome you as our new colleague!
What we offer
The team you will become part of, the colleagues around you, and the tasks you are involved in all contribute to your job satisfaction. However, there is no such thing as a free lunch. Therefore, we offer attractive terms. Flexible working is more ordinary than an exception. Also, you are in charge of your own career development: with energy, perseverance, empathy, and courage, nothing will block your own career. The more you develop yourself, an increasing number opportunities will appear that in enable you to steer your career and make it as unique as you want it to be. On top of that, what more to expect at EY:
Experience the unique EY drive while working together in teams and connect with colleagues during one of the many drinks or social events.
Discover the opportunity for rapid professional and personal development; kick-start your career by being involved in challenging projects, growing responsibilities, learning from experienced colleagues, building an extensive network, and attending a variety of workshops.
We offer you intensive training (hard & soft skills) and education besides your work, support by a personal counselor and buddy, and support with education - temporal and financial.
We offer an environment with inspiring leadership. The (team) management wants to inspire employees, both professionally and personally. Working at EY is working with the world leaders of tomorrow.
You can find more about the terms on www.werkenbijey.nl/en_nl.

Due to laws and regulations, and because EY (and in some cases its clients) has high demands on the reliability and integrity of its employees, every new employee will be screened. Depending on your rank the pre employment screening could contain the following: Certificate of Conduct (in Dutch: VOG) or - if requesting a Dutch VOG is not possible - Criminal Background Check of the country you are currently living or have lived during the last five years, integrity questionnaire, verification of ID, diploma’s and/or work experience and consultation of the Dutch insolvency registry.

Legal Counsel (Group Business Legal)
As Legal Counsel, you will be expected to provide professional legal services on behalf of the Group Legal team. This position is in the Group Legal Business team, which principally provides transactional advice and support to our commercial domain, but also to our shared services domain, predominantly our IT and Procurement teams.
Day to day:
as Legal Counsel you will be generally expected to perform the following functions:

Negotiate and document global vendor program agreements and related amendments
Document and negotiate other multi-jurisdictional agreements, including cross border financings and negotiate multi-jurisdictional end user facing agreements
Provide transactional support to our product overlay teams.
Support commercial domain projects that require legal input and support
Negotiate and document agreements with suppliers, including IT and services contracts in conjunction with business and other internal stakeholders
Negotiate and research legal issues related to data privacy, cybersecurity arrangements and contract risk structures based on relevant laws, rules and regulations.
Work on project teams to advance and develop various DLL group level efforts
Contribute to the development and implementation of policies and procedures.
Develop, implement and maintain high quality contract templates and related standards and procedures for use.
Implement and employ internal controls to monitor and assess legal risk and coordinate remedial efforts thereto.

Health and Wellness program including healthy food, free health checks, fun health & vitality activities.
Flexible hours with possibility to work from home
Career development opportunities: online learning, member development programs.

Law degree/ (LL.M) from a reputable university/law school. Strong preference for a Dutch law degree, but law degrees in any relevant jurisdiction will be considered.

maximum 3 years’ experience in a legal environment as a corporate, financial services or transactional lawyer.
Experience working autonomously in a fast-paced environment (including as part of a relevant internship) is a preference.
Excellent English speaking and writing skills.
Willingness for occasional domestic or international travel.

Choose wellbeing
DLL’s wellbeing ambition is to educate, equip and empower members to build connections, manage their mental, emotional, physical and financial wellness and maintain balance between work and the other priorities that make up their lives.

Our four wellbeing categories are as follows:

Connection – Build meaningful connections with other DLL members
Health – Manage mental, emotional and physical health
Finance – Provide learning opportunities to help members achieve personal financial health
Lifestyle – Maintain balance between work and life priorities

These are the things that matter to our members and the wellbeing of our members matters to DLL
Settling in
At DLL, we are many things. We are team members, family members, community member. We are members of society, members of different cultures and nationalities. Members of change. We each have different beliefs, different passions, different viewpoints, talents and interests. We become from different backgrounds, cultures, nationalities and histories.

But for all of our differences, we share one thing in common: each of us are members of DLL.

Our company was founded in the Netherlands. But today we are truly a multinational business. Our unique culture is rooted in higher collaboration, less hierarchy and a honest directness that enable us to integrate, ideate and innovate across country lines.

Many companies say they are European, American, Asian or Australian, at DLL we are all these places and more.

We are a cross-culture collaborative – an interconnected network – that comes together every single day with one goal in mind: Partnering for a better world

EY is een wereldwijde speler actief op het gebied van (Tech) Consultancy, Assurance, Tax, Transactions. Met onze expertise, systemen en financiële diensten dragen we bij aan een betere werkomgeving. Dat begint met een cultuur waarin je training, kansen en creatieve vrijheid krijgt om jezelf en EY continu te verbeteren. Van kleine bedrijven tot 's werelds bekendste merken, onze klanten rekenen op betrouwbare financiële overzichten. Binnen Assurance speel je een belangrijke rol in het creëren van vertrouwen. Je analyseert de gegevens achter de bedrijfsactiviteiten van onze klanten, zodat zij, hun investeerders en hun toezichthouders een duidelijk beeld hebben van hoe ze presteren. Dit is essentieel voor van het goed functioneren van de maatschappij en de financiële markten.
Bij EY Technology Risk vinden wij ons vak het mooiste dat er is. Met alle nieuwe technologische ontwikkelingen is ons vakgebied continu in beweging. Doordat bedrijven IT-systemen steeds breder inzetten, is ons werkveld heel dynamisch. Door het analyseren van IT systemen, IT processen en Cybersecurity geven wij organisaties een duidelijk beeld hoe zij hun IT risico's beheersen. Hiermee geven wij de maatschappij en de financiële markten het vertrouwen dat IT technologie op veilige wijze wordt ingezet zodat, onder andere, privacy gevoelige gegevens of financiële gegevens veilig worden verwerkt.
Naast Amsterdam staat deze positie ook in Rotterdam, Eindhoven, Den Haag, Utrecht, Zwolle, Groningen en Hengelo open.
Wat je bij ons kunt verwachten – een verrijkende ervaring waarvan je een leven lang profiteert
Voor het uitvoeren van onderzoek in een snel veranderend vakgebied, zoeken wij ambitieuze stagiairs met een focus op IT risico beheersing. Als scriptiestagiair(e) verricht je zelfstandig onderzoek vanuit ons kantoor, waarbij het onderwerp van de opdracht in onderling overleg wordt vastgesteld. EY zal jou een begeleider en mentor toewijzen die je ondersteunen bij het formuleren van de probleemstelling bij de start van je scriptie, maar zeker ook (academische) begeleiding geven gedurende je stage. Daarnaast helpt hij/zij je wanneer je praktische vragen hebt en zorgt ervoor dat je, indien gewenst, een aantal dagen kunt meelopen in de praktijk. Als stagiair heb je een focus op zowel de business- als de IT-kant van grote organisaties. Je zult je kennis van deze twee vakgebieden in snel tempo uitbreiden en de steeds belangrijkere vertaalslag tussen IT en de Business gaan maken. Een afstudeerstage biedt jou de gelegenheid om tijdens het afstuderen een waardevolle en relevante ervaring op te doen.
Wat je meebrengt – vaardigheden waarmee je de toekomst vorm geeft
Je bent aan het einde bent van je opleiding Business Information Management (of –Systems), Business IT & Management, (Technische) Bedrijfskunde, Accountancy of een soortgelijke studie
Je hebt een sterke affiniteit met IT
Je beschikt over een kritische mindset, oog voor detail en verantwoordelijkheidsgevoel
Jij bent iemand die zich prettig voelt in een internationale omgeving waarbij samenwerken, helder communiceren, flexibiliteit en creativiteit vooropstaat
Wat wij je bieden – een inspirerende werkomgeving
Wij bieden een inspirerende werkomgeving, waar collegialiteit en kwaliteit hoog in het vaandel staan. Aanvullend daarop:
Hebben wij verschillende scriptie onderwerpen klaar liggen, maar bieden we jou ook de vrijheid om zelf een interessant onderwerp aan te dragen
Ontvang je een mooie stagevergoeding (€900 op basis van fulltime)
Word je als scriptant volledig onderdeel van één van onze lokale teams
Ontdek je de mogelijkheden voor snelle professionele en persoonlijke ontwikkeling, in de vorm van trainingen en workshops
Maak je een optimale carrière start door het leren van ervaren collega's, het opbouwen van een uitgebreid netwerk en het ervaren van werken in een professionele omgeving

The Legal & Compliance team consists of a Legal Team for Outflow (6 FTE), supporting the Investments business globally with legal advice in structuring and contracting transactions in equity, credit and renewable energy, two Corporate & Inflow legal counsels, supporting and advising Oikocredit and related entities on a broad range of corporate legal and regulatory matters as well capital raising, product offering and marketing, a Legal Operations Officer, a Paralegal (new role) and two Compliance Officers supporting the organization in identifying and managing their compliance risks and creating compliance awareness.

The Legal & Compliance team is responsible for providing excellent legal and compliance services and support in the organisation while at the same time being critical in monitoring the legal and compliance risks. The Legal & Compliance team plays a crucial role to ‘protect and enable’ Oikocredit’s business and strategy.

Your role

Together with the senior legal counsel Corporate & Inflow you will be advising on a broad range of corporate legal and regulatory matters. You will be called on to support the business in fulfilling its legal and regulatory obligations. You will work together with a variety of professional disciplines. While protecting Oikocredit’s interests, you negotiate, manage and conclude your client matters pragmatically, with a ‘can do’ attitude. You will work closely with the senior legal counsel Inflow & Corporate and report to the General Counsel.

Main responsibilities

You will have two main area of focus; legal and regulatory compliance and contractual advice in the field of capital raising (Inflow) and corporate matters.


 In the area of legal and regulatory compliance, you will contribute to ensuring the fulfilment of legal and regulatory obligations of the offices and legal entities of the countries assigned for capital raising for Oikocredit; monitor and advise on applicable new laws and regulations, translating these into internal guidelines and procedures; identifying legal risks and raising awareness of legal risks and other legal aspects of our operations in a broader sense.


From a contractual point of view, you will provide independent advice and take full documentation responsibility in straight forward contracts/agreements and will provide documentation and project assistance to the senior legal counsel Corporate & Inflow on more complex contracts/agreements. Examples of what you will be working on are service agreements, cooperation agreements, terms and conditions and data processing agreements.


Besides this, you will provide hands on advice to Investor Relations and Oikocredit’s operations to comply with applicable regulation, such as Prospectus regulation, CSR regulation and Privacy regulation and the onboarding and exit process of members and investors (together and in close cooperation with the compliance function) regarding among others Wwft and Customer Due Diligence.

You will work closely with and under supervision of the Senior Legal Counsel Inflow & Corporate in managing the ownership and maintenance of global legal and corporate strategy tasks.

You will build and maintain good relationships with external counsel, coordinate a network of Dutch and local legal experts and manage the legal costs involved.


Your background

We are looking for someone who believes in Oikocredit’s mission, is highly committed and is driven to excellence. We require a Legal Officer who holds themselves accountable, proactive and eager to grow their skills. The ‘must haves’ for this role are:

A Masters’ Degree in Dutch law or European law, or equivalent in another jurisdiction (with some background in Dutch/European law); preferably with a specialization in corporate, financial or civil law.
Minimum 4 years of relevant work experience.
Fluency in English, both verbally and in writing. Fluency in another language is an asset;
Ability to work independently and with great sense of responsibility.
A committed team player with an international attitude, down to earth, pragmatic, pro-active and result-oriented with strong project management and social skills.


What we offer

Legal work with real impact: making a difference for those who need it most.
An inclusive, international and diverse environment.
Flexible work environment with a good work-life balance.
Wide opportunities for professional personal development.


How to apply

Are you excited about the role? Express your interest and apply for this position by submitting your application in English, including your CV and a letter of motivation.

Read more at www.oikocredit.coop/jobs/working-for-oikocredit.

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. Due to globalisation and developments within technology the structure of organisations are undergoing a lot of changes. As a technical solution architect at EY you support organisations with these transformations. Our teams exist of specialised consultants with different backgrounds. Our consultants are involved in a variety of projects, from developing up to implementing a strategy within different industries. Our core areas are Customer Experience Technology, Experience Design, Organisational Transformation and Data Analytics.
The opportunity
With rapidly changing cybersecurity threats, clients from all industries look to us for trusted solutions for their increasingly complex risks. As a member of our Cyber Threat Management team you will be involved in attack and penetration testing, vulnerability assessments and red teaming and focus on identifying potential threats and vulnerabilities in client IT environments. You will belong to an international connected team of specialists helping our clients with their most complex cybersecurity needs and contributing toward their business resilience. You will be working from our Advanced Security Center in Amsterdam together with our Advanced Security Centers around the globe to access the most sophisticated tools available to fight against cybercrime.
Our security professionals possess diverse industry knowledge, along with unique technical expertise and specialized skills. As part of our Cyber Threat Management team, you’ll identify potential threats and vulnerabilities to operational environments. Projects here could include penetration testing, red teaming and simulating physical breaches to identify vulnerabilities.
Your key responsibilities
You’ll work with our practice in Amsterdam, and have the following responsibilities:
Perform penetration testing which includes internet, intranet, wireless, web application, social engineering and physical penetration testing.
Execute red team scenarios to highlight gaps impacting organizations security postures.
Identify and exploit security vulnerabilities in a wide array of systems in a variety of situations.
Analyzing code (security code review)
Perform in-depth analysis of penetration testing results and create report that describes findings, exploitation procedures, risks and recommendations.
Execute penetration testing projects using the established methodology, tools and rules of engagements.
To qualify for the role you must have
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Information Systems, Information Technology, Engineering or a related major.
0 to 2 years of related work experience;
Some experience with manual attack and penetration testing.
Some experience with scripting / programming skills (e.g., Python, PowerShell, Java, Perl etc).
Updated and familiarized with the latest exploits and security trends.
A driver’s license valid in the Netherlands
Willingness and ability to travel within The Netherlands to meet client needs.
Ideally, you’ll also have
Any of the following certifications OSCP, OSWP, GPEN, GWAPT, OSCE, OSEE, GXPN; non-certified hires are required to become certified within 1 year from the date of hire.
Knowledge of Windows, Linux, Unix, any other major operating systems.
Familiarity with the latest exploits, tactics, techniques and procedures (TTP), vulnerability remediation and security trends in Cloud implementations.
Deep understanding of TCP/IP network protocols.
Deep understanding and experience with various Active Directory attack techniques.
Understanding of network security and popular attacks vectors.
An understanding of web-based application vulnerabilities (OWASP Top 10).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in Dutch and English
Strong client services orientation and accustomed to taking a proactive role in engagements
Flexible, responsible and self-confident personality, who feels comfortable in client’s environment

Our consultants stay highly relevant by researching and discovering the newest security vulnerabilities, attending and speaking at top security conferences around the world, and sharing knowledge on a variety of topics with key industry groups. If this excites you, this is the opportunity to grow your career at EY!

Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.

Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
Modern working environment and equipment, fostering mobile working flexibility
